contextId.occurrenceNote: Zechariah compares the way in which the angel interrupted his being in deep thought with the way someone would awaken another person from sleep. Alternate translation: "caused me to become more alert like a man awakened from his sleep" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: roused me like a man roused from his sleep

contextId.occurrenceNote: The people refusing to hear and obey Yahweh are compared to their being as unyielding as rock. Here the heart represents the will of a person. Alternate translation: "They stubbornly refused to hear the law or the words of Yahweh of hosts" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: They made their hearts as hard as rock so they would not hear the law or the words of Yahweh of hosts

contextId.occurrenceNote: The Israelites sometimes thought of lightning bolts as arrows that God shot. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: his arrows will shoot out like lightning!

contextId.occurrenceNote: The people of Judah will shout and celebrate their victory over their enemies as if they were noisy drunks. Alternate translation: "Then they will shout and celebrate their victory as loudly as if they were drunk" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: Then they will drink and shout like men drunk on wine

contextId.occurrenceNote: This probably refers to the bowls that the priests used to carry animal's blood to the altar. Alternate translation: "they will be as full of wine as the basins with which priests carry blood to the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: they will be filled with wine like bowls

contextId.occurrenceNote: Altars had projecting corners that were drenched in animal blood. Alternate translation: "they will be drenched as the corners of the altar are covered in blood" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: like the corners of the altar

contextId.occurrenceNote: The people of Israel are spoken of as if they are God's sheep that he cares for and protects. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: God will rescue them ... as the flock of his people

contextId.occurrenceNote: The people who do not have true prophets who tell the truth are spoken of as sheep who do not have a shepherd to tell them where to go. Alternate translation: "the people who listen to the false prophets are like sheep who do not know which way to go" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])

The people who do not have true prophets are spoken of as sheep who suffer because they do not have a shepherd to tell them where to go. Alternate translation: "the people who listen to the false prophets ... are suffering like sheep who do not have a shepherd to guide them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: they ... suffer because there is no shepherd

contextId.occurrenceNote: The rulers from Judah are spoken of as if they were victorious warriors. Alternate translation: "They will be mighty in battle, trampling their enemies into the mud of the streets" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: They will be like warriors ... streets in battle

contextId.occurrenceNote: "Ephraim" refers here to the northern kingdom of Israel. Warriors are strong. Alternate translation: "Ephraim will be very strong" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: Ephraim will be like a warrior

contextId.occurrenceNote: This simile means Yahweh will enable the leaders of Judah to be strong and able to lead the people to defeat their enemies. Alternate translation: "like firepots among stacked firewood ... unharvested stalks of grain standing in a field" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: like firepots among wood ... standing grain

contextId.occurrenceNote: This simile means those who are weak will be strong. Alternate translation: "those who are weak will be strong like David" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: those who are weak among them will be like David
